paper.title: The Internet worm incident
paper.abstract: On the evening of 2 November 1988, someone “infected” Internet with a worm program. That program exploited flaws in utility programs in systems based on BSD-derived versions of Unix. The flaws allowed the program to break into those machines and copy itself, thus infecting those systems. This program eventually spread to thousands of machines, and disrupted normal activities and Internet connectivity for many days.
